title.narrative: Core support to Innovation Centre Kosovo
Core support to Innovation Centre Kosovo

description.narrative:
Innovation Centre Kosovo has requested a core funding of 14 million SEK to carry out the Strategy Plan "'Scaling up and further consolidation of startup ecosystem 2019-2022'' during the period 2019-2022. The total amount of the budget is 5,3 million Euro.
The cooperation with Innovation Centre Kosovo (ICK) during the first phase of core support 2015-2018 has worked well, both in terms of quality and timely deliveries. Almost all the results have exceeded the foreseen plans. For six years, ICK's incubator department has launched 18 calls for proposals and 2 cross sectorial calls (Women edition and FinTech). Over 200 start ups were accepted to be part of the ICK’s incubator, where 65 were women co-founders and out of which 170 new registered companies have been established. Total number of internal training courses delivered was 210 to almost 3000 trainees. Internal event organized were 356 (over 450 including events co-organized in partnership with others) attended by more than 40 000 participants. Sida has been satisfied with a cooperation and achieved results.
The overall new objective is to support the aspiration of individuals, private companies, government and foreign investors for development, by propelling innovative ideas and introducing new products, services and operations that improve the lives of Kosovo citizens, and increase competitiveness of local economy through utilizing services and network of Innovation Centre Kosovo.
ICK Strategic plan 2019-2022 is structured around the following key pillars:
1. Innovation-startup enabling environment is one of the most important pillars that ICK will focus on. Start-up incubator will offer services such as training, coaching, mentoring, and other forms of capacity building and transfer of know-how will be continued under the upcoming programing cycle. On the other hand, ICK will offer technological space for all interested star-ups and businesses, and will continue to support start-ups and businesses through grants and innovation funds.
2. Empowering entrepreneurship and promoters of Innovation: ICK’s vision for the future entails additional efforts in inclusion of marginalized groups, spinoffs, minority communities, diaspora, civil society, and the government. This will be implemented by identifying the needs, organizing entrepreneurial events throughout Kosovo, increasing skills, networking and improving skills to improve employment and self-employment.
3. Focusing on key priority sectors: ICK will diversify sectoral presence and included, social entrepreneurship, sustainable innovation, and government innovation. Promoting innovation and increased application of technology across different sectors, is crucial also for increasing effects across the society and contribute to its overall modernization.
The overall budget for implementation of the ICK's Strategic Plan 2019-2022 is planned to be 5,3 million Euro, out of which: Sida (2019-2022) will give a core support budget with an amount of 14 MSEK (1,4 million Euro), GIZ (2018-2020) with 904 230 Euro, Norway (2018-2020) with 234 438 Euro, EU/EDF/ICK (2018-2020) with 316 668 Euro, European Fund for Southeast Europe (EFSE) (2018-2019) with 92 833 Euro, Kosovo Ministry of Innovation and Entrepreneurship (2018-2019) with 196 244 Euro and ICK’s own funding is planned to be 760 000 Euro. There is a budget gap of 1,4 million Euro for 2020-2021, which is expected to be filled in with contributions from other possible donors.

Vision:Modern society in which innovation and entrepreneurship are an integrated part of our culture & society, and a major factor of development and improvement of the living standard of all citizens.Mission:ICK aims to advance innovation and entrepreneurship to new levels, in which entrepreneurial spirit and culture of innovation are reflected amongst individuals, companies and government, through creating a functional ecosystem in which ventures are supported to growth and sustainability.Overall Objective:ICK will support the aspiration of individuals, private institutions, governments and foreign investors to achieve development by generating innovative ideas and introducing new products, services and operations that improve the overall quality of life of Kosovo citizens, and increase competitiveness of local economy, through creating of a functional ecosystem Specific Objective 1. Contribute to improving Innovation and startup enabling environment This objective will be reached by providing direct financial support for startups and innovative SME’s through Grant Funds, through government and CSO support and through providing new services for start-ups and SME’s such as:- Improved market access information and linkages for startups, SME’s and foreign direct investors;- Promotional services through digitalization;- Physical and technological infrastructure such as free rent space in Pristina and expanding in 3 other cities;- Access to finance through matching funds, Innovation fund, Angel Club, Crowdfunding platforms and partner with accelerator; Specific Objective 2: Improving the skills of youth and improve employment and self-employment prospects Increasing and improving the skills of youth and competences relevant to today’s market and improving employment and self-employment will be reached through:- Improved professional trainings - Training large number of youth in the areas identified as being in high demand. This would create critical mass of seasoned professionals to satisfy the needs and export aspirations of Kosovo companies;- Fostering entrepreneurship through incubation, mentoring and voucher schemes;- Technical services for its beneficiaries including but not limited to office space, hosting and other services;- Facilitate Internships, Job Placements and Direct Employment of students at existing companies. Specific Objective 3: Support and Promote entrepreneurship and Innovation ICK aims to advance innovation and entrepreneurship to new levels and integrate them in our culture. This objective will be reached to:- Constantly promote and increase awareness on the importance of innovation and entrepreneurship through, so that ventures are supported to growth and sustainability;- Have a high participation of target audiences in our innovations programs and schemes;- Organize entrepreneurial events throughout Kosovo; networking gatherings, connect participants to potential collaborators, mentors and even investors—introducing them to new possibilities and exciting opportunities;- Increase the number of women/girls in ICT sector. Specific Objective 4: Increase of innovation and modernization of key sectors of interestAs part of the new strategy pillars and activities, ICK has identified Technology, Sustainable Innovation, Social Entrepreneurship and Government Innovation as four main innovation priority sectors. By increasing activities that lead to innovating and modernizing these sectors, ICK will create an impact in the ecosystem. This objective will be achieved by:- Introducing and encouraging the application of technology in relevant sectors;- Support cross-sectorial projects through incubator department;- Seek ways to engage relevant stakeholders in innovation and technology application.

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

title.narrative: Grant agreement between Sida and Innovation Centre Kosovo 2019-2022

description.narrative:
Specific Objective 1. Contribute to improving Innovation and startup enabling environment This objective will be reached by providing direct financial support for startups and innovative SMEs through Grant Funds, through government and CSO support and through providing new services for start-ups and SMEs such as: - Improved market access information and linkages for startups, SMEs and foreign direct investors; - Promotional services through digitalization; - Physical and technological infrastructure such as free rent space in Pristina and expanding in 3 other cities; - Access to finance through matching funds, Innovation fund, Angel Club, Crowdfunding platforms and partner with accelerator;
Specific Objective 2: Improving the skills of youth and improve employment and self-employment prospects Increasing and improving the skills of youth and competences relevant to todays market and improving employment and self-employment will be reached through: - Improved professional trainings - Training large number of youth in the areas identified as being in high demand. This would create critical mass of seasoned professionals to satisfy the needs and export aspirations of Kosovo companies; - Fostering entrepreneurship through incubation, mentoring and voucher schemes; - Technical services for its beneficiaries including but not limited to office space, hosting and other services; - Facilitate Internships, Job Placements and Direct Employment of students at existing companies.
Specific Objective 3: Support and Promote entrepreneurship and Innovation ICK aims to advance innovation and entrepreneurship to new levels and integrate them in our culture. This objective will be reached to: - Constantly promote and increase awareness on the importance of innovation and entrepreneurship through, so that ventures are supported to growth and sustainability; - Have a high participation of target audiences in our innovations programs and schemes; - Organize entrepreneurial events throughout Kosovo; networking gatherings, connect participants to potential collaborators, mentors and even investorsintroducing them to new possibilities and exciting opportunities; - Increase the number of women/girls in ICT sector.
Specific Objective 4: Increase of innovation and modernization of key sectors of interest As part of the new strategy pillars and activities, ICK has identified Technology, Sustainable Innovation, Social Entrepreneurship and Government Innovation as four main innovation priority sectors. By increasing activities that lead to innovating and modernizing these sectors, ICK will create an impact in the ecosystem. This objective will be achieved by: - Introducing and encouraging the application of technology in relevant sectors; - Support cross-sectorial projects through incubator department; - Seek ways to engage relevant stakeholders in innovation and technology application.
